abstract: Eni, the European oil company, agreed to buy Dominion Resources‘ exploration and production assets in the Gulf of Mexico for $4.8 billion to triple its output from the region. The purchase will raise Eni’s production in the Gulf to 110,000 barrels of oil equivalent a day by the second half of 2007, from 36,000 barrels a day now, the Rome-based company said Monday.
lead_paragraph: Eni, the European oil company, agreed to buy Dominion Resources‘ exploration and production assets in the Gulf of Mexico for $4.8 billion to triple its output from the region. The purchase will raise Eni’s production in the Gulf to 110,000 barrels of oil equivalent a day by the second half of 2007, from 36,000 barrels a day now, the Rome-based company said Monday.

headline.main: Eni Buys Gulf Of Mexico Assets for $4.8 Billion
